title: Getting Started with bccp
text: bccp package implements Bin-Conditional Conformal Prediction (BCCP) generating valid prediction intervals coverage guarantees within user-specified outcome bins. particularly useful count data time series forecasting traditional conformal prediction methods may provide adequate coverage across different outcome ranges. method based Blair, Coppock & Moor (2024).

title: Getting Started with bccp
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("lassa-sentinel/bccp") library(bccp) library(ggplot2)

text: Bin-conditional intervals: Separate prediction intervals different outcome ranges, ensuring coverage guarantees within bin Zero-inflation handling: Optional separate bin zero values, useful count data excess zeros Seasonal extension: bccp_seasonal() handles non-stationarity conditioning outcome bins time periods Coverage metrics: Built-functions evaluate interval coverage width

title: bccp - Bin-Conditional Conformal Prediction
code: library(bccp)  # Generate synthetic data set.seed(42) n <- 500 x <- runif(n, 0, 10) y <- rpois(n, lambda = exp(0.5 + 0.2 * x)) pred <- exp(0.5 + 0.2 * x)  # Split into calibration and test calib_set <- data.frame(y = y[1:400], pred = pred[1:400]) test_set <- data.frame(y = y[401:500], pred = pred[401:500])  # Apply BCCP with 90% target coverage result <- bccp(calib_set, test_set, alpha = 0.1)  # Check coverage metrics <- coverage_metrics(result) print(metrics)

code: # Generate synthetic data set.seed(42) n <- 500 x <- runif(n, 0, 10) y <- rpois(n, lambda = exp(0.5 + 0.2 * x)) pred <- exp(0.5 + 0.2 * x)  # True mean  # Split into calibration and test calib_idx <- 1:400 test_idx <- 401:500  calib_set <- data.frame(y = y[calib_idx], pred = pred[calib_idx]) test_set <- data.frame(y = y[test_idx], pred = pred[test_idx])  # Apply BCCP result <- bccp(calib_set, test_set, alpha = 0.1)  # Check coverage coverage <- mean(result$y >= result$lower & result$y <= result$upper) cat("Coverage:", round(coverage, 3), "\n") #> Coverage: 0.91

title: Seasonal Bin-Conditional Conformal Prediction — bccp_seasonal
text: calib_set Calibration data frame containing y, pred, time info test_set Test data frame receive prediction intervals y_col Name response column (default: "y") pred_col Name prediction column (default: "pred") time_col Column name time stratification (e.g., "month", "season"). NULL date_col exists, months extracted automatically. date_col Name date column (used time_col NULL) id_col Optional column name row IDs n_bins Number bins positive values zero_bin Whether use separate bin zeros alpha Target miscoverage rate (e.g., 0.1 90% coverage) grid_length Number grid points interval construction min_stratum_size Minimum calibration points per stratum. Strata fewer points fall back pooled (non-seasonal) thresholds. exclude_empty_strata TRUE (default), bins zero observations time stratum excluded prediction sets. produces tighter intervals low-activity periods. season_mapping Optional named vector mapping months seasons, e.g., c("1"="winter", "2"="winter", ..., "6"="summer", ...). seed Random seed reproducibility

title: Seasonal Bin-Conditional Conformal Prediction — bccp_seasonal
code: # Generate seasonal synthetic data set.seed(42) n <- 1000 dates <- seq(as.Date("2020-01-01"), by = "week", length.out = n) month <- as.integer(format(dates, "%m"))  # Seasonal mean: higher in winter (months 1-3, 11-12) seasonal_effect <- ifelse(month %in% c(1, 2, 3, 11, 12), 2, 0.5) y <- rpois(n, lambda = seasonal_effect * 3) pred <- seasonal_effect * 3  # Perfect seasonal prediction  # Add noise to predictions pred <- pmax(0.1, pred + rnorm(n, 0, 0.5))  df <- data.frame(date = dates, y = y, pred = pred) calib_set <- df[1:800, ] test_set <- df[801:1000, ]  # Apply seasonal BCCP result <- bccp_seasonal(calib_set, test_set, date_col = "date", alpha = 0.1)  # Check coverage coverage <- mean(result$y >= result$lower & result$y <= result$upper, na.rm = TRUE) cat("Coverage:", round(coverage, 3), "\n") #> Coverage: 0.86

title: Calculate Coverage Metrics — coverage_metrics
code: # Generate data and apply BCCP set.seed(42) n <- 500 y <- rpois(n, lambda = 5) pred <- rep(5, n)  calib_set <- data.frame(y = y[1:400], pred = pred[1:400]) test_set <- data.frame(y = y[401:500], pred = pred[401:500])  result <- bccp(calib_set, test_set, alpha = 0.1) metrics <- coverage_metrics(result) print(metrics) #> $coverage #> [1] 1 #>  #> $mean_width #> [1] 11.62763 #>  #> $median_width #> [1] 11.62763 #>  #> $n_valid #> [1] 100 #>  #> $n_total #> [1] 100 #>
